'''''Mythlore'' 24''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol7/iss2/ Volume 7, Issue 2]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].
==Contents==

====Articles====
* Gray, Thomas. “Bureaucratization in The Lord of the Rings.”
* Christopher, Joe R. “Three Letters by J.R.R. Tolkien at the University of Texas.”
* Boenig, Robert. “Lewis’ Time Machine and His Trip to the Moon.”
* Purdy, Margaret R. “Battle Hill: Places of Transition in Charles Williams’ Descent Into Hell.”
* GoodKnight, Glen. “Myth in the Media.”
* Weinig, Sister Mary Anthony. “Exchange, Complementarity, Co-Inherence: Aspects of Community in Charles Williams.”
* Bell, Albert A., Jr. “Origin of the Name ‘Narnia’.”

==== Poetry ====

* McMurdo, Ian. “Three Songs from The Bubbling Sky.”
* Lenander, David. “Aragorn Gazes on Ruined Arnor.”
* Gunter, Patricia E. “Half There.”

====Features====

* Ellwood, Gracia Fay. Editorial.
* Berman, Ruth. Discussion Reports.
* GoodKnight, Glen. Owen Barfield in Southern California (2).
* Christopher, Joe R. An Inklings Bibliography (13)
* Questionnaire.
* Speth, Lee. “Cavalier Treatment: Once More Round the Cauldron.”
* Letters.

====Reviews====

* ''C.S. Lewis on Scripture.'' Michael J. Christensen. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''The Rainbow Goblins.'' Ul de Rico. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''Narnia Explored.'' Paul A. Karkainen. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''Pictures by J.R.R. Tolkien.'' Foreword and Notes by Christopher Tolkien. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''Reading With The Heart: The Way Into Narnia.'' Peter J. Schakel. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''Arthurian Legends: An Illustrated Anthology.'' Ed. by Richard Barber. Reviewed by Robert S. Ellwood, Jr..
* ''Enchanted World: Pictures to Grow Up With.'' Bryan Holme. Reviewed by Robert S. Ellwood, Jr..
* ''A Tolkien Bestiary.'' David Day. Reviewed by Thomas M. Egan.
* ''A Middle-Earth Album: Paintings.'' Joan Wyatt. Reviewed by Thomas M. Egan.
* ''T.H. White.'' John K. Crane. Reviewed by Joe R. Christopher.
* ''Voices for the Future: Essays on Major Science Fiction Writers.'' Ed. by Thomas Clareson. Reviewed by Joe R. Christopher.
* ''The Agatha Christie Mystery.'' Derrick Murdoch. Reviewed by Joe R. Christopher.
